developerResponse: {'id': 38163550, 'body': "We're truly sorry to read that you had a negative experience with the ads! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Support here: https://watch.viki.com/help", 'modified': '2023-08-08T08:33:06Z'}
review: I have had Viki for about two years in those two years I have had the Viki standard membership, but unfortunately I have had to cancel my subscription but kept my account. The main problem I am running into is the ads. I don’t mind them when they actually play all the way through. But there are certain ones that just refuse to play and then I am sitting and waiting for a 23 second ad that takes 10 minutes to play. It is frustrating, but we understand that you have to get revenue to keep the service free for those who cannot pay for the subscription. But if you could fix the ads from freezing that would be great. The show is 53 minutes long but it takes two hours to watch because a ad freezes up. And it’s not my internet. Update I just uninstalled the app probably for good they just updated it but now when you are watching a show either the ads freeze or the whole thing freezes and then the app shuts down. What was a great app is now so bad that unless you can afford the subscription is not worth having three hours of trying to watch one episode, and it is not my internet because I watch other streaming apps without any of the issues that I am experiencing with this app. I usually don’t leave a review but it’s gotten so bad since the update that I will probably not reinstall. Not unless they fix the bugs.
title: Great content, but crashes or freezes

review: Discovered Viki last year and it is a must-have app that offers a broad variety of enjoyable new and classic Asian programs.  It is my #1 entertainment App that is portable as is available to go on my cell phone & tablet.  I would, however, consider the idea of double checking the English translations for accuracy and better dialogue flow if Viki would contact me.  These shows have opened my eyes to Asian cultures and customs that previously I knew little about especially: honorifics, formally confessing Love that seems so widespread with Asians, eating well and sleeping well, soju and wedding and funeral venues.  The stunning outer beauty of Asian peoples as well as the inner beauty can be most compelling!  It would seem people around the world are the same and we all want to enjoy the good things in life despite hardships and tribulations that sometimes we must endure.  I for one enjoy a great story that is not laced with unnecessary and distracting profanity, sex and extreme violence.  Viki has provided programming that doesn’t force me to clench my teeth!  Thank you for expanding into the American market and keep it coming!  I will continue to be your #1 Fan!  :)
title: Viki is my go-to entertainment app

developerResponse: {'id': 41188606, 'body': "We're truly sorry to read that you had a negative experience with us! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Support here: https://watch.viki.com/help", 'modified': '2024-01-10T00:57:43Z'}
review: I’ve written a review for this app before, it was about how after my free trail was over and I didn’t renew the subscription I started to get a message saying I couldn’t watch any show because of a vpn installed but I never had a vpn and the problem persisted after doing everything the tech support and the viki support team told me to try. I uninstalled the app for a few days but decided to try watching on my bfs tablet when it started working so I paid a subscription for the tablet and I thought what if it worked on my phone now and it turns out paying helped my VPN problem. Stop advertising this as a free to pay service when many reviews show that you will cause technical problems that can only be resolved with paying your subscription. There used to be many good streaming sites that never had this problem or had actual means of helping its consumers whereas it seems the most you can do is respond to these questions and problems with automated sorrys and links that are already provided on your website under FAQs. This app is horrible and the only reason I still use it is because it’s made it so it’s the only legal and safe way to watch my favorite shows without risking viruses and other major problems. Fix your app
title: Second Review VPN

review: I wanted to leave a review for your Customer Support. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ I was having trouble with  reading the subtitles on my tv app and was unable to adjust the size, font or other settings so I could adequately read and enjoy what I was watching. Becoming frustrated, after doing everything that I could think of to resolve the issue for myself, I sent an email to Customer Support pleading for help. This was on a weekend morning and I was prepared to have to wait for a response. To my GREAT surprise, I had a response within 9 minutes!! The young lady (Joy) who replied was incredibly friendly and provided crystal clear directions for what steps to take to resolve my issue. I had been on the right track with my original troubleshooting, but she was able to give me some further instructions to get it working. Best Customer Support I have dealt with in a long time!
title: Great Customer Support!

review: The content on Viki is generally of excellent quality across a broad range of genres. But what truly distinguishes Rakuten Viki from other streaming services is the social component, enabled by interactive, real time comments. Sometimes the comments will make you LOL; other times a viewer will share a perspective or will point out a detail that other viewers may have missed. On rare occasions one may find the comments intrusive and they often contain spoilers. But it’s easy to disable comments when watching a movie or show if you want to. I keep the comments on and enjoy the social experience of exchanging commentary with other viewers around the world. I also like the links to artists’ bios and industry news; and ability to curate a fan collection. Keep up the great work Viki!
title: Content and Comments

developerResponse: {'id': 36268443, 'body': "Thanks for reaching out! We're sorry to hear about your unpleasant experience on Viki. If you have any further questions or concerns, contact our Help Center: \nhttps://watch.viki.com/help.", 'modified': '2023-05-02T01:26:33Z'}
review:
Retrying to Viki after a long time. I stopped because they moved a lot of theirs shows to another tier that cost even more money. At time the translators were unpaid volunteers that received some membership benefits. The translators were/are the best part. . Sadly app doesn’t work for me. The ad will pop up but it will not start playing. The screen is then frozen so my only option is to close it and keep trying. Had no luck. I can’t watch anything. . Also I’m not sure why the viewers history was removed. It’s such a useful feature that helps us keep track of what we’ve watched.
***update***
Got it to work. I believe one particular Ad was the problem. I clicked on “learn more” and it opened we up the ads website, went back to Viki and video started playing. I skipped forward and got another set of ads. Those played without delay.
title: App needs work

review: I love that the developers are opening this app for free and joy of any charge to those wanting to watch K-dramas. I’m currently watching Mouse, and ads ruin the mood SO MUCH. I rarely ever complain but this is too much. there are 3 ads in one row and it really makes viewers like me annoyed because a few ads are fine, yet not when it’s often every 10 minutes. I understand it covers the costs for us being able to watch movies and shows freely. however, I wish it were better. For us to enjoy actually watching, there should be a limit on ads :/… one second im watching something incredibly sad and next I have to go past an ad that’s 30 seconds long (each 3 of the ads) Creators, please understand and do something about controlling the length and occurrence of the ads. Thank you.

review: I love this app like so much because everytime I’m trying to find a Asian show it’ll be here and I don’t have to spend hours trying to find what I’m searching for or look for this app has BL’s and straight dramas I’m into BL so I use this app mainly to watch BL’s I can’t find anywhere else that’s the pro some cons about this is majority of them require a subscription it’ll be the best dramas too that u have to subscribe to watch so it’s hard trying to find a good one without having to subscribe I already have a subscription for iQIYI so another app adds onto payments and it’s so much to subscribe to 2 apps iQIYI has more Asian and BL dramas so that’s why I am mainly subscribed to iQIYI but I do love viki and will continue watching non subscription shows on here

review: It’s really good for being free, but there are lots of things that you do need to buy in it if you want to watch certain things but that’s ok, BUT the main thing that’s bothering me and the reason I am writing this review otherwise I would have kept my mouth shut is that within 20 minutes I had 6.5 minutes of ads so I only had 13.5 minutes of watching the actual show and you typically get 3 ads IN A ROW, and that just seems a bit excessive to me and you get them four times for a 30-40 minute long episode and it’s quite ridiculous, but overall it has a lot of great qualitys as far as subtitles and free aspect so I would definitely recommend it if you have any patience for ads at all it will be great. I do think the app is great  as a whole tho

developerResponse: {'id': 39253647, 'body': "We're truly sorry to read that you had a negative experience with us! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Support here: https://watch.viki.com/help\n", 'modified': '2023-10-02T05:19:52Z'}
review:
I used to love Viki. Enough to be a VIP subscriber for the past few years. I loved the great collection of dramas and reality/variety shows (which included all of the primary episodes)! However, in the past year, Viki managed to remove all of the earlier episodes from reality shows like " 나 혼자 산다" which was one of the reasons I got the VIP pass~ to be able to rewatch those old but gold episodes! 
As subscribers, we did not received any notification regarding these major changes and whether they would be temporary or permanent! I see the comments from the other subscribers being genuinely upset about this lack of courtesy from Viki, but my comments keep getting deleted on the app! 
None of the contents we originally loved and subscribed to Viki for are available. What's the point of paying for the VIP subscription/ month if there is no quality content available anymore?!!!
title: Stop Deleting My Feedback Viki!

review: Excellent app with outstanding content! For those complaining about adds, spend the $6 per month to get rid of them. Geez! Vast amount of high quality content for basically two cups of coffee. We are fortunate to have Viki and the dedicated teams translating, bringing so much great Asian content to other parts of the world. So much less expensive than tracking down and purchasing expensive DVD/Blu Ray’s that go out of print quickly! And the app works great on my Apple and Roku devices. My only recommendation is for Viki to add additional older historical K-dramas. I would really love to be able to stream “Six Flying Dragons”, “Jumong”, “Emperor of the Sea” and others.
title: Excellent app with outstanding content

review: I have had this app for a month now, and it is one of the best apps I’ve ever had! My dad got me a subscription because the only thing that annoyed me was the same ads replaying back to back, plus there was something I really wanted to watch that was only on Standard. The no ads have been great! When I did have them it didn’t annoy me too much, only when I had the same long ad playing four times back to back. I hope to see new dramas added this year! A drama I would love to see added is called Be With You starring Ji Xiao Bing and Zhang Ya Qin from 2020! Overall, this app is absolutely perfect and has so many different shows!
title: This is amazing!

developerResponse: {'id': 36852490, 'body': "We're truly sorry to read that you had a negative experience with us! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Support here: https://watch.viki.com/help", 'modified': '2023-06-01T00:00:53Z'}
review: While I can see that this app is great for those who subscribe to it, it’s really craptastic for those who are not subscribe. I understand that the ads are there for non-paying customers but, holy crap on crack, those ads are so annoying. Not only does it play literally almost every 4 minutes, it also crashes the app and then when you try again it makes you watch the same commercials that crashed the app in the first place. I wanted to give this app a chance but this crappy experience just makes me not want to. I get that I can remove the ads by paying but I assess apps based on their offerings for non-paying customers. If non-paying customers are happy with an app then guaranteed the paid version is even better. I can’t say the same for this app. Greedy.
title: Annoying

title: Great app. Good selection overal but…

review: I have recently got into BL dramas and stories, and for awhile I was just fine with books. But then, I was doing research online and found I could watch the shows that (some) of these books are based on. And that’s when I found this wonderful app, it has been such a joy to watch these stories come to life with amazing actors, and to aid in my understanding of the different cultures and countries these stories are from. I love everything about this app, and I appreciate everyone who does the translations. (I’m in the process of learning Thai so hopefully I won’t need them for long)!
title: My new obsession

When I started the episode again it started 30min back from where I was and gave me 2 ads just trying to fast forward to where I was 😭The other time it completely restarted my episode and when I tried to fast forward it I got 3 more ads. Overall I watched about 10+ ad breaks and only 20 minutes of episode. Literally watching another ad break as I’m writing this 💀 I understand I’m going to get ads without a subscription and I’m a broke college student so that’s totally fine with me but this is too much 😭

developerResponse: {'id': 37620112, 'body': "Thanks for reaching out! We're sorry about your unpleasant experience. If you have any further questions or concerns, contact our Help Center: \nhttps://watch.viki.com/help.", 'modified': '2023-07-12T00:18:18Z'}
review: No better content out there if you wish to watch Asian dramas. However, the apps are full of bugs. For example, it doesn’t sync across or even withIN devices. So if you’re watching on an iPad, don’t count on the app tracking which episodes you’ve watched when you’re using your iPhone. What’s worse is the app “forgets” which episodes you’ve watched ON THE SAME DEVICE. There’s also an annoying bug that keeps asking you to leave real-time comments while watching the show, even if you’ve turned this stupid feature off. Rakuten can do much better here - please improve the app to match the quality of your content.
title: Great content / app is awful

review:
I finally had to write a review for Vicki. I cut the cable and just use streaming services. And of all the ones that I have this is my go to app. They have the latest and greatest movies that you can find. And the majority of the movies are already translated. Some of the newer movies just hitting the market , usually have episodes translated weekly or more often. There translation teams are wonderful!!!
Hats off to those guys. Do your self a favor and sign up now-even if you've never watched Asian dramas before, I think you will be pleasantly surprised.

title: Ads don’t load

review: You can watch a lot of stuff for free, but I pay for the membership so I can watch as soon as something gets uploaded. Love the app and all the dramas they put up. If there is something you want to watch and they don’t have the rights for it you can fill out a form and if you show enough interest in the show they get the rights. They have apps for your phone, tablets and TVs. There is one thing that would make Viki better, and that is to also put the app on Microsoft’s Xbox. I hate switching from Xbox to tv.
title: Worth every penny!

 This app is so amazing like I wanna get the other pay one but I’m to broke but that okay🤷🏻‍♀️ I at least have something to watch! Thank you for making this app!!

review: I love Viki most of the time. I watch it more than any other streaming station I have. However the thing I think that needs work on is when you foward or go back on the specific show, it should show a preview of where you are in the show. Like Netflix does when you foward or rewind. There’s many times where that function would be of great help. Also, which is probably nothing to do with your company, you get most of the dramas that we all want to see but sometimes not. Other than that I do enjoy all the content that is there!

review:

I have standard but Viki doesn’t seem to appreciate that because they stress I have no features it seems like were the forgotten tier when we’re paying actual money ya know 😭 it’s okay. Now I have my months i upgrade but downgrade again because im literally on other platforms don’t price us out
title: Quit laughing at us

review: Look this app is amazing I can watch so many shows that I want. But every time the ads just randomly freeze in the middle of the show and it's annoying. It wastes my time especially when the show is interesting. There was this show semantic error I was watching and when the ads came i had to wait 5 minutes for each of them to finish becuase of the random pauses. It's always the Disney ad that pops up and it randomly pauses! Anyways the shows there are awesome! I have found so many shows I could watch. My favorite one has to be semantic error. I'm going to continue my journey on watching Asian dramas!
title: Fix ads

developerResponse: {'id': 35018606, 'body': "We're truly sorry you feel this way! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Community Support here: bit.ly/VikiHelp", 'modified': '2023-02-22T16:27:03Z'}
review: I’ve had Viki in the past and we decided to revisit and subscribe. I downloaded the app and subscribed for the year and used my Apple ID to login. This caused issues because not all of our TVs or tablets use Apple. My wife also purchased a monthly subscription at the same time so I requested my subscription be canceled so that we can use her subscription with her email and password to login to all electronics. They refused to cancel and process a refund. So now, I paid $99 annual and wife paid $9.99 monthly. She has canceled her subscriptionSo that they don’t charge her in the upcoming months. This seems like an unfair practice which we will further explore.
title: Practices

developerResponse: {'id': 37040488, 'body': "We're glad to hear that! And if there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Support here: https://watch.viki.com/help.\n", 'modified': '2023-06-10T09:37:04Z'}
review:
I absolutely love this app! I have been using it for years now and have not had any issues up until now…other than that this app has amazing shows and movies that are all worth watching! They are so so interesting.
 However now when I go to watch a show it tells me to turn off a proxy/vpn and I have no clue why because I do not have one on at all and this is a new device and everything. I want to watch my shows but other than that I have not had any issues.
title: Great app

review: One of my 4 sources for Asian dramas, especially BLs.  I haven’t not been a subscriber since I first discovered the absolute, pure awesomeness and joy of Asian dramas. Then I discovered the existence of Boy’s Love dramas and that was it. My joyfully anti-social life is complete. I will never not have a subscription to Viki. This is a must for Asian dramas. Out of the 4 sources, I only subscribe to two and I can not see myself ever giving up subscribing to this app even though there are other platforms that are free. It’s just to good and worth it to me.
title: I can not do life without this app.

review: To be honest I’ve been looking for a app like this to watch all my fav dramas and I finally found a app that works perfectly I def recommend downloading this all and don’t waste your time trying to find another app that probably won’t work and when your watch any of your fav dramas it’s not blurry or anything it’s like regular Netflix and yes theirs ads but for once the ads are very short and only come like once every 30 mins or more I def recommend
title: I love this app to watch your fav dramas

developerResponse: {'id': 18973739, 'body': 'Hi Chubasco, we apologise for the error on the Apple TV device. It has now been fixed. We are also working to provide a unified experience across devices so you can enjoy watching on whichever platform you prefer. ', 'modified': '2020-11-09T03:14:43Z'}
review: The app has the worst bugs in the 2nd most important function of a streaming service. It can’t properly keep track of your progress. Nearly 100% of the time it either starts me at the beginning of the last completed episode, or starts me nearly at the end of the next episode, or both. And with no “restart from beginning” option I’m forced to rewind through the entire episode that I want to watch…is this a 1986 VHS tape rental Easter egg? If so, then it might be funny if I weren’t paying for this service. This would be a 4 or 5 star service we’re it not for the worst bugs in the most basic of functionality.
title: Unacceptable bugs in a paid service

review: When I tell you this app is amazing to watch like literally anything I mean it’s literally the best app ever! It doesn’t cost any money and has all of the show that you would possibly like! I love how there’s even reviews for the movie and it has tons and tons of shows and movies! But the problem is, is that there’s just too much ads some of the ads can be up to 3 and 30 seconds without a skip button it makes me annoyed but again this is the best app for watching shows and movies and it’s all free!!
title: AMAZING!! But it just has one problem

review: The drama selection of Viki is pretty good in terms of it’s variety. My only complaint is that whenever I watch something specifically on my iPad, it seems that the signal is wishy washy. My system has the most recent update and I’ve tested my signal for Wi-Fi, and nothing seems to be out of the ordinary.  I can watch my dramas on my laptop with no problem on the same network, so I don’t know what makes playing on my iPad any different.
title: Decent drama selection

review: It has various types of drama and all..but there’s just too many ads it asked for premium every now and then like every 3/4 minutes it’s like begging for money hate that especially…just let the customer watch for like the first time and show ur ads and ur premium don’t continuously show like that oh and I’m also not using from now onwards I also don’t recommend this app to download i thought it’s a service to us but y’all are just like beggars hate that….
title: Love the app But…..

review: I love Viki but because I pay for it l. I used to watch with ads and it was just not worth it. In any case, as a subscriber now, I’ll never stop as long as I stay watching dramas which I know I will. It has great subtitles, the app works great on phone, tv, and firestick. I only wish it had the option to have different profiles because I share the account with my sister and we can never watch the same show at a different pace. I still love it though and we make it work.
title: Best app for Asian dramas

review: I get that the free version runs ads, but it’s like 18 min of ads for every 5 min of content watched and then after about 30 min the app glitches and it restarts the program from the beginning so I have to watch another 18 min of ads before I can fast forward to the part I need to be to continue watching and then this repeats so it takes me like 2 hours to watch a one hour program! When you advertise “watch free” you should have an * that says “with 30 min of ads and the app will restart before you can finish” clearly the ads are the problem causing the app to glitch and restart! Fix this please!
title: Glitchy with too many ads!

review: I absolutely love this app! 🙌🏽 If you have a love, like, or even mild interest in cdramas, kdramas, tdramas, or any Asian movies or series then this is your spot!! I haven’t watched regular TV in almost a year because I’m so engrossed in the high quality series and movies on here! You can create a watchlist, favorites and collections list, write reviews, and read information on every actor in each drama or film! I can even set alerts to watch the new works from my favorites! This app gets all the stars!
title: Absolutely Amazing! Get it!

review: I’m not disappointed in the dramas movies that they have. I am disappointed in how the app is working on my Roku TV and on my iPhone since the last big update. I wrote them and they keep saying they’re going to fix things and they haven’t fixed anything yet. The TV is not synced to the iPhone so when I go on either one, I can’t tell what I just watched if I watched it on the other one. And the blue lines for continue watching is not there a lot of times. Also, my watchlist gets changed around so often and my latest thing is that I put in there aren’t even in there.
title: Disappointed

developerResponse: {'id': 34376810, 'body': "We're truly sorry you feel this way! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Community Support here: bit.ly/VikiHelp\n", 'modified': '2023-01-19T09:34:48Z'}
review: I wanted to download a specific drama to watch offline, the app prompted me to upgrade and purchase a more expensive pass to do so. After paying for it, it no longer allowed me to download the drama so I tried reaching out to customer service. They asked me a long list of questions trying to see if it was a technical issue on my end (which it wasn’t). They still haven’t resolved my issue nor given me a refund. It’s really frustrating to also speak with customer service or technical support all via email as it’s really slow, time consuming, and not accessible at all. It’s also annoying to get a ton of separate emails for just 1 issue.
title: Poor Customer service and technical issue

developerResponse: {'id': 37883131, 'body': "We're truly sorry to read that you had a negative experience with us! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Support here: https://watch.viki.com/help", 'modified': '2023-07-25T06:57:37Z'}
review: First of all, the video compression is sub par.  Streaming takes too much bandwidth adding to the cost of viewing on this platform.  Second, the functionality is kludgy to say the least.  Controls do not allow you to start over, skip intros or even resume where one left off.   Episodes don’t have descriptions.  The app interferes with the operation of other basic Apple apps.  I could go on…but being the only content provider for the shows we want, we have to deal with this ‘Beggar’s’ version of a streaming app.
title: Functionality far inferior to Netflix, Prime Video and Other Platforms

review:
For some reason the ads aren’t loading😅
I’m the weird one that would rather pay with my time watching ads than pay the easy way that everyone else chooses🙃
I find that when the ads come in properly, it grounds me so that I can take a second to not be upset with the drama but reflect on how the actors are doing, then I give a high rating of the shows I watch. Otherwise, if something threw me off in the show I would rate it less haha
title: All the Stars! 🤩

title: Um it’s ok

review: Despite being Asian living in the Bay Area, I am only able to speak English, but I love Rakuten Viki!   The subtitles make that possible, as well as the program offerings,  the ease of using the app, and the reasonable cost.  It was my brother who now lives in the Philippines who recommended this service to me as I was looking for Korean and Japanese reality tv shows and Netflix  mainly offers Asian movies.   I hope Viki continues to offer many more reality based/competition programs in the future!
title: Love this streaming option!

review: Given the diverse library of programs, I’m usually able to navigate currently watched programs and the items on my watchlist. It would be nice to be able to organize my watchlist and other searches a little more logically- the current system shows the most recent additions 1st… and if I ‘click’ on a given show to read the details and then return to Home Screen… I have to start all over with the scrolling to get back to where I left off… it’s a little frustrating.
title: Does an Admirable Job…

review: I think Viki is a really good app with many different series but the only problem I have is there laggy ad’s. I will sometimes wait a long while waiting for the ad just to play and even sometimes have to exit the app multiple different times. But other than that the app is amazing and I don’t have any other issues with it.
title: Amazing app! But sometimes laggy ad’s

review:
I love the app and all but sometimes i cant watch what im trying too for one of 2 reasons, without having to pay for episodes or there’s too many adds. 

I would REALLY appreciate if the adds PER 2 MINUTES were lowered. Like have them at least spread out in the episode and not all together. That makes it really frustrating to watch. 

And for the “special episodes” i would REALLY like to be able to watch them more freely. For example, i was trying to figure out what app i could watch “Don’t say no” (a bl) on. I came across Viki and tried it out. I did end up watching it on here but i couldnt get the episode i was really hoping for.

Overall. Good app just would appreciate the thought of being able to watch without interruptions. Wouldnt rlly recommend. Unless you’re okay with LOTS of adds and not able to watch specific things.
title: Too many adds and sometimes i cant watch something i really want to.

review: It’s a really good app and has SOOOO MANY amazing shows on it, the only thing i don’t like as much is that some shows you have to pay for a pass to watch past the first episode. Other than that it’s really great and i would definitely recommend to people who like watching Asian dramas (there are so many shows that are not on anything else.)
title: Great app

review: Viki has a great selection of Kdramas.  My favorite category is romantic comedies.  I do wish that when watching a new series, I could see the day, date or even count down how many days until the next new episode of the series will be available in my time zone.  I also wish that there were a way to remove series/movies from the Continue Watching list once I’m finished watching something (similar to Remove from Watchlist dies).
title: Great selections!

developerResponse: {'id': 38338173, 'body': "We're truly sorry to read that you had a negative experience with us! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Support here: https://watch.viki.com/help", 'modified': '2023-08-17T05:29:51Z'}
review:
I’m assuming this app has the potential to be great but I cannot get past the ads to even watch anything. If I select an episode it opens to an ad, where it will then freeze and remain until I close the app myself. I still get pop ups that I can exit out of but if the ad doesn’t play there’s nothing I can do. I’ve deleted the app, logged out and in, nothing.

While I’d be entirely willing to pay for premium, I wouldn’t do that without ever having used the app or watched a single video on it. If I’m having this many problems while it’s free I certainly won’t pay if the quality of the app cannot be assured. Bummer, I was really looking forward to it.
title: App doesn’t work?

review:

review: Love, Viiki has a lot of my shows serious movies that I love to watch even some of the other ones I’ve never seen before. I fell in love with them and had to see them from finished to the end and as they go along with the series or the full movie, I think they’re great. title: Great site full movies, and series

review: When I first downloaded the app I also downloaded iQIYI so I could compare the two cause it was my first time using both! Tbh Viki is so much better and easier than iQIYI because iQIYI has rlly long ads and so many of them and there the same every time and y have to get a membership to watch most of the shows, in Viki  you only need the membership to skip the ads and the ads aren’t that long! title: AMAZING

review: I wish I’d heard about Viki sooner, especially as a long time Rakuten (Ebates) user. I’ve always loved Asian dramas but finding a wide variety of them under legal means has always been a challenge. Once I found out this was the real deal and how much there is on offer I signed up for the standard monthly subscription, no more adds! Even with adds it been a great service. Been recommending it to my friends learning other languages and coworkers who speak other languages.
title: Get your Asian Drama fix the legal way!

title: Love this app!

review: So when I get finished with An ad there be another right after it,this has happened a few times . I can’t afford the pass and I keep getting the 53 second ad and it goes down very slow. title: Great but some complaints

review: This app is👌chefs kiss! My friend recommended this to me (we’re both addicted to dramas). This app has it ALL. You can pay premium but the free ones are pretty good too. They have subtitles in so many languages and you can have comments (basically a twitch chat on the top of the screen, you can turn this off though). It’s so addicting that I pulled an all nighter to watch half of a Chinese drama called My Unicorn Girl. Check it out!
title: speechless!!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 41188644, 'body': "We're truly sorry to read that you had a negative experience with us! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Support here: https://watch.viki.com/help\n", 'modified': '2024-01-10T01:01:32Z'}
review:
Ok well, where can I start… 
I downloaded the app to watch true beauty because Netflix used to have it but then it was gone so I didn’t have the chance to watch it. I know I shouldn’t expect anything from an app you don’t “have” to pay. I just came here to watch true beauty but the when it comes to the adds, it freezes and it won’t work anymore. I’ve wasted 15 minutes watching “3 adds” and when I want to paused it, it goes back to the adds. Worst app ever. I won’t pay either way. You’re probably going to have a pretty good app if you pay but I don’t wanna waste my money on this app that isn’t working for free.
title: Not satisfied

review: Originally I got this just to watch MDZS per recommendation, and I didn’t have a lot of storage so I was planning to delete it right after, but the viewing experience was GREAT. Not to mention the variety of shows was TOP TEIR! Within 24 hours I’ve already found 6 shows that were worth my time and suited my tv desires and interest!! I rarely write reviews but this app really did it for free streaming! <3
title: COMPLETELY worth my storage!!

review: I hate writing reviews but I will for this app. I've had this app for about a year now with the free subscription and wow! Even though with the free subscription you don't get access to every drama, there are still a ton of great dramas on there for free I use this app very often and I'm happy with it each time. I have never gotten an inappropriate add and the app is very easy and safe to use! 10/10 I recommend!
title: Yes! And it's safe

review: I love using this app and has a variety of shows to watch. I’ve been using it for the last 3 years and recently this year I  started using plus. I was pretty content with the app until recently, reality shows such as home alone, 2 days 1 night 4, and master in the house no longer have earlier episodes, huge chunks are now gone from those shows. I wish to know why this has happened.
title: Great app but older episodes gone

developerResponse: {'id': 34996161, 'body': "We're truly sorry you feel this way! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Community Support here: bit.ly/VikiHelp", 'modified': '2023-02-21T16:31:26Z'}
review:
I really enjoy watching  Viki TV.

However, all of my disappointments fall in line in recognizing that Viki doesn’t have or seem to want to have open and honest feedback on their programming. 
 1. There should be  built in to each show an opportunity to give it a thumbs up or thumbs down.
 2. Maybe a category to WATCH AGAIN.
3. Listen and respond to subscribers on anticipated shows not currently shown in region and make real attempts to release those programs.
4. STOP deleting huge blocks of episodes of variety shows.  You can always break them down by seasons or year (s).
5. Make attempt to bring to screen majority if not all works done by major artists.  From early works to present. (If possible)

These requests seem to be basic without passing costs to accommodate them on to subscribers by hiking membership costs.

Thank you.
title: Viki is REALLY GOOD, COULD BE GREAT

review: I have been with Viki since 2015 to current, never regretted and on time Viki pass subscriber. A lot of shows and up to date with a lot of shows out there. Subtitles pretty good ! Even if you have to wait a little bit it’s definitely worth it. It has a lot of volunteers translators and they been really great ! I’m happy customers for 8 years already. Check it out 👍
title: One of the best app for Kdrama and Cdrama lovers

review:
Kdramas and Asian shows are watched a lot in Iran and on the other hand you know that the government just filtered everything, every app and every website. So the only way to use this app is by turning on the vpn or using a proxy. And it was so ridiculous because when I turned the vpn on it said you should turn it off and when I turned it off it didn’t load anymore!!
I know this is not your problem and probably the users of just one country do not matter that much to you, but I just wish at least using an app was easy in this situation we’re having or others were kinder to us.

Viki plays the best movies I know I love the Korean movies I can remember all of the stars that I love to see act that I love to see working rather it’s Japanese, Chinese you just know how to do your movies great actors  but I would love you to see actor Lee Min-ho’s movie, “Bounty Hunter”, City Hunter. Please bring it to Viki.  I would appreciate it if you were to bring those two movies I have been asking for the last three years now, come on!!😘😉☺️
title: Love Josen movies,

review: I absolutely loved and enjoyed watching true beauty it was the best show I’ve ever watched and tbh I cried at the end when it ended even though it was a good ending I was just sad it ended but I loved it and enjoyed it and I emotionally connected myself to that show so I was upset when it ended but it was great while it lasted and I went through a whole rollercoaster of emotions but it was amazing ♾️/10!!!!!!
title: Best app in the entire world

developerResponse: {'id': 39391267, 'body': "We're glad to hear that! And if there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Support here: https://watch.viki.com/help.", 'modified': '2023-10-09T00:16:10Z'}
review:
Good variety of movies & tv. Streaming quality excellent.
Minor issue with ads. Rather than video ads, it sometimes just pauses the video and plays an audio ad. They repeat too often, sometimes the same ad in three successive breaks. 
Video ads can also be repetitive, sometimes back to back in the same break.
Can’t beat the price (free) though, so it’s all good.
I’d like to see a filter for free tv/movies, but I understand why not.
title: Almost great

review: When I’m watching, I’ll get as many as 6 ads in a span of a few minutes. The app also gives me ads that aren’t marked on the video progress bar, which is extremely annoying. I was watching a scene where a main character was about to get killed, and I got bombarded by ads while trying to watch it. It’s not a very good experience when you’re watching a scene with a lot of tension, and then you’re interrupted by a CarMax ad in a language you can’t even understand.

review: I love the variety of programs available on this application! I have had for more than a year and consistently get new options to choose from in a variety of languages (Japanese, Thai, Chinese, Korean, Taiwanese, etc…) I also love everything from action to romance! The subtitles are top quality and usually available in multiple languages.
title: Love the Variety

review: The best K-drama I have seen since I fell in love with k-dramas in the 8 years. There is probably none that will surpass my expectations now or in the future.  The plot and scriptwriting was excellent, the words and delivery of message are unexpectedly precise and different from other dramas. Kudos to the director, cast and crew for a very outstanding production. My biggest praise and compliments to the leading actor and actress for the amazing & awesome job .  Lee Hang-hyun and Yoo Gil-chan are truly unforgettable.
title: My Dearest

review: So I’ve been watching drama’s since I was a teenager. I used different app’s and programs to try and keep watching them, but so far, this one is the best. I love it and I’m so glad that I came across it! Well worth the money for no commercials and being able to download episodes and watch on the go. I’ve even gotten my mom to watch some drama’s with me as well 😁
title: Amazing app!

review: Vicki is great! It offers many great dramas that have kept me entertained. A whole new world of entertainment opened up for me plus I love seeing and learning about other cultures and people. But I have also seen that we all share the same concerns, wants, and needs in our lives. I appreciate the opportunity to enjoy all the stories!
title: Glad I signed up!

review: Series are well vetted for completeness.  Never loose the channel.  Great record keeping for planned viewing and recording what you  have e seen and reviewed.  Good price for number if series watched.   Finally available on my Kindle and my laptop. And especially my I phone.   Thanks you for all your hard work.
title: Best streaming platform

review: I have tried several sites or apps to watch any sort of Asian dramas and I always come back to VIKI. They have a great variety of Korean, Chinese, Japanese and etc dramas and movies. Also reality shows as well. The key here is there subtitles they have great subtitle translations and one of the main reason I keep coming back to VIKI! Subscribed and never looked back!!
title: Love VIKI!!!

review: Since the last update this app stop working for a few minutes when watching any serie. Need to close the app and open it again. And that is for many times a day. Please check this out Im getting frustrated!!!!  I love this app really and I don’t want any problem with it!!!! Thanks
title: Stop working

review: this is my go to kdrama app but I wish it had just one subscription tier like most streaming video services. It’s pretty disappointing to sign up and find out certain shows require an upgrade for non obvious reasons. So I mostly stick to free and the ads aren’t as bad as they used to be but right now the volume is cranked up so it blasts away at every ad break while Im trying to watch quietly in the middle of the night.
title: add are too loud

review: I love watching all of my Korean  dramas on Viki. The only issue I have is that when I end an episode whether it is in the middle or the end of the episode, or if I watch it on a different device, it does not continue at the same spot I left it on. If you can work on that issue that would be great!
title: Living Viki!

review:
Excellent selection of current dramas - also at times they will also add great older dramas. Would be great if they were able to add more older dramas - perhaps picking up some from the discontinued Dramafever library, which had a vast selection.

Recently have seen older dramas showing up—that is fantastic.
title: Kdramas

review: With the latest update, I cannot use the app anymore. There should be an option to use an older version of the app for those using an older device with older iOS. A pop-up message seems to offer the option to download the last version that works with my iOS, but the download button doesn’t work and doesn’t do anything, probably because I was already using the latest version of the app that supported older iOS. Now I cannot use this app at all.

review: I like it because it’s the only place I get to watch good shows and I don’t mind the adds. The only problem with this is that the adds take so long to play. This is a big part in my viewing because it really disrupts everything.

review: Viki app has a lot of variety compared to others, but they use of it could be better. it should show which episode that has been watched off different devices better. Also add which family member accounts separately so we don’t have to keep track who watched what and where they left off.
title: Great but could be better

review: I really love the app however, there’s been a bug involving timed comments that has not been fixed for months. on both the iPhone and iPad app I am not able to leave any comments on a show. when I try to send a comment, the app crashes and I am forced to restart it. it’s fun to watch the shows, but when you have no way to interact with others it dampens the mood. and yes, my viki app is updated along with all my devices.
title: unable to leave timed comments

review: Although I wish there were less ads during movies and shows this app is honestly amazing! The shows are amazing to binge when your bored, I also love that you can watch all these shows for free! An amazing app for lgbtq+ representation too. 10/10 amazing app I would recommend
title: Amazing 🔥🔥

title: Good but one problem

review: So when I downloaded the app, I was hoping for it to just let me watch my k dramas with no ads and stuff. Unless your really annoyed with ads and bugs and glitches with this app, I would not recommend because it wont stop asking me for a free trail and there were so many glitches when I couldn’t even watch it. So I would NOT recommend this app. If this app works best for you, then that’s your business. But now, I just think this app doesn’t work for me and others, so I give it a 1 star. Good luck.
title: Check this out

review: Probably the best translations I have seen. I appreciate the translating teams taking their time to translate it correctly with the original intent rather than sloppily localizing it. It’s rare to find that level of detail. I hope they are compensated well because it has been incredibly enjoyable.
title: Amazing translations

review:
I’ve had the Viki Plus for couple of years now and

title: Love the app

review: 10/10 stars! Great free content and affordable upgrade to Viki Pass. I downloaded this app about 10 months ago and have been glued to it since. So many shows and movies to watch, and new content is constantly uploaded. My favorite go to app! Must have for any fan of Asian tv/movies.

review:
Learn Mode is removed from the service. This was the main reason I wanted to use Viki. I will cancel my subscription for this reason. 
Please update all of your “help files”. When I search Google for how to use dual-subtitles, I see official looking documents that imply Learn Mode is still active. In fact there are still official “curated lists” of shows that supposedly have Learn Mode (which of course they don’t since you got rid of that feature…!)

review: This platform allows movies and shows to depict suicides. It is a disservice to society as it demonstrates and glamorizes suicide. It is incumbent upon them to shield the viewer of the grotesque depiction of suicide in all its forms. Otherwise, viewers will be less inclined to copy or feel empowered to complete the act. Until it is removed, this generation will see a far greater number of suicides, not just in S. Korea, but viewers worldwide. Be responsible for the sake of mankind.
title: Too much suicide

review: Great content! However the user interface absolutely blows. Whether I’m using my phone, tablet, or smart tv, Viki has difficulty remembering where I left off on a show. There also isn’t an option where I can skip to a particular episode from the menu. Fast forwarding and rewinding in an episode has been a real pain in the rear.
title: Please fix UI/UX

review: I was introduced to Viki by my dtr and her family during the pandemic shut down. I have been so pleased with the service. There are so many shows, dramas, movies and shows to choose from. Viki has opened up a whole new world to me.
title: Love this service

review:

review:
I upgraded to the pass plus so I can upload.  Last 3 months the app would only allow download on chapter 1 and nothing else. I finally wrote to support and it seems to be fixed now.  Thank you 

Only downside is if the movie is downloaded on my phone and I use a different device, it would attempt to delete all the downloads on my phone before I can download on new device 

I don’t have this issue with Tencent and IQIYI 
Might reconsider in renewing after subscription is up.
title: Pass plus for download

review: Terrible app compared to other streaming services. Lots of deficiencies, like very limited video search parameters, won’t save reviews or let you delete them, can’t edit them either. developerResponse: {'id': 34160226, 'body': "We're truly sorry you feel this way! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Community Support here: bit.ly/VikiHelp", 'modified': '2023-01-09T04:18:41Z'}
review: Recommend using another service if possible. Subtitle translations range from awkward to flat-out wrong (eg 5 thousand vs 5 million).  But the Premium service in particular is a scam. The main benefit seems to be downloading episodes to watch later. However, the downloaded content feature is so buggy that I regret paying anything for it. One time on a plane the app logged me out of my account and I couldn’t log back in (that was a long 5 hours). Another time all the content I had downloaded inexplicably disappeared. (Tech support says they’re working on it, but I haven’t heard of any progress for a week now.) Sometimes trying to play downloaded content simply crashes the app. This all happened within a week of me signing up for the service, so I’m sure there are more bugs that I just haven’t experienced yet. In addition, learning mode simply does not work without an internet connection, even when viewing downloaded content. This does not appear to be a bug, but appears to be by design, and tech support told me that it is not a priority for them to fix right now. I thought learning mode was one of the selling points of this service, but since it requires an internet connection to use anyways, I recommend getting the language reactor extension to chrome and using any other streaming service if possible. If the content you are looking for can only be found on Viki, whatever you do, sign up for the cheapest monthly plan possible and cancel it once you’ve seen what you want. I made the mistake of purchasing a year membership in advance, thinking I would use this service enough for it to be worth it. Then when I foolishly attempted to upgrade to a premium membership in order to download content for some travel, I was forced to either purchase and annual premium membership or wait until my annual basic membership had expired. Now I’m short $125 with only buggy, poorly translated streaming service to pay for it. Of course, Viki says that none of this justifies a refund. Save yourself. Don’t do what I did. If you must use Viki to watch your favorite show, pay the minimum amount then cancel your subscription immediately.
title: READ THIS before paying for PREMIUM MEMBERSHIP

review:
Because although a lot of the movies are great they’re  trying to cheat me out of my money and they’ve done it before. This happened last January but I couldn’t prove it so I just let it go. This year it happened again and this time I had proof. So what did they do? They cancelled my subscription. How did they cheat me? Well on January 6th they charged my accounts its monthly fee, I had no problem with that because that’s what I signed up for after all. 
———————————————————————————————————Then on January 28th they charged me again. I thought they were doing the February bill early but I was still uneasy so I wrote apple to watch out and please make sure they don’t charge me again un February since I had paid already on January 28th. I made sure that I still had my receipts stating that the transactions had gone through. But lo and behold on February 5th I was charged again. I immediately found my receipts and sent everything to apple. They decided in my favor, (although the refund has yet to be sent back to my account). Next thing know my subscription was cancelled and when I say cancelled I mean immediately everything was shut down. You know how they usually give you the last month? Not so they didn’t even give me that.—————————————————————————————————————- So here I am with over $30 spent for a one month subscription period. I sent the evidence to Viki as well but still nothing. So like I said, although some their movies are great I can only give one star because they’re trying to cheat me. If you want to charge me twice in the first month of the year I MIGHT have agreed to it if you sent a notice or something stating that this would happen, but the fact that you trying to sneak and do it is what gets me. You didn’t tell me you just did it. —————————————————————————————————————-Last but not least, If this is a computer glitch then I most humbly apologize because obviously it wasn’t done on purpose, I truly do because my computer be acting whack sometimes too. But you need to get your IT department to fix it because I don’t like being cheated, no one does.

developerResponse: {'id': 37620119, 'body': "We're truly sorry to read that you had a negative experience with us! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Support here: https://watch.viki.com/help", 'modified': '2023-07-12T00:19:38Z'}
review:
There is a support website where users post issues. The problem is that the “customer support” will acknowledge that the problem is being looked into and then, CLOSE the ticket!  

As if, they actually solved the problem!  By closing the ticket, they ignore you and dismiss the problem, sweep it under the rug and prevent other subscribers facing the same problem from voicing their similar concerns or opinions.  

I am a paid subscriber and have had the same issue for almost a year.  Once a month, I will open a case. Within a day, they will close the case but never resolve the issue.  They cut off all communication with me, the original poster.  They straight up GHOST you.

Once they forgot to close one of my cases immediately and several other users were able to comment on my issue and I could see that this was frustrating other subscribers worldwide.  They immediately “closed” the case with no resolution.  

If you go to their zendesk support page, you will see thousands of examples where subscribers open a case to point out a problem they are encountering only for the Viki “support” team to swiftly close the case, with no resolution, no conversation with the subscriber… just an automated response that essentially says, “We have received your message.  Your case is closed.  We are cutting off further communication.”

In short, if there’s any glitch or issue, please know that they will not even waste a single second to make anything right.  You will have to tolerate it until you reach a point, like I have, where you simply give up, wait for your subscription to run its course and eventually, unsubscribe.
title: Customer Service GHOSTS You

review:
I love the Korean Costume Period movies & tv series where romance & comedy is in them - also while as you get into the character’s history - you get their background history and a little of world history.    The Koreans have a delightful sense of humor.    The Viki Originals Iin this genre I enjoy very much.   I also liked Kocowa series and movies in this drama.   Not to crazy about the modern age ones.   Hope to see more rom.com in the costume period movies & series

Also make it where a member can go back and watch an episode or the series as often as they want - had a hard time doing it - 

My respect to the developers and staff - thank you
title: Wonderful APP

review: I watch a lot of Thai dramas and I have been using YouTube and it’s fine but this is way better. I like how it has the full episodes and the subtitles stay on for just the right amount of time. Also the subtitles are not that big and I like that. There are not very frequent adds and I am supper happy about that. But the one think I say would need a bit of improvement on is that the show is a bit blurry it’s not bad at all but it would make this app way better.

review: I had signed up for a regular subscription then decided to upgrade to the premium subscription 2 months later.  I agreed to pay the difference of the 2 subscription plans for the remainder of the subscription (I opted to pay for the year), about $50. There was a pop box that asked if you agree to this amount.  Instead they charged for another full subscription, $99.99.  I reached out to them and they told me there would be no refund because I “agreed” to the amount.  They offered to give me a “complimentary” 6 months after the subscription period ends - which is about what they overcharged me.  I will also have to email them for the code 1 month prior to the end of my subscription, instead of it just being applied to my account.   VERY DISAPPOINTED.
title: Terrible customer service

title: Jaw dropping and phenomenal!!!!!

review: I love this app and it allows me to be able to watch all the dramas I want. I love K-Dramas and listening to the show, while reading the subtitles. I am rather new to K-Dramas but in the past year I have watched more than 30 plus shows. I love them. I started on Netflix but moved over to this app. It is totally worth the subscription. Sometimes they have the same shows here but in a different name. I was going to break up it’s K-Dramas after the ending of two shows since they sucked but I am glad that I have stuck with it. At 50 I find myself dreaming of going to Korea to find my “”chairman or Director” LOL. I am an autism teacher and have a savant in my class who is obsessed with languages and is teaching me how to read and speak Korean. As a middle school teacher we watch one video on YouTube a day to learn some new words and practice them throughout the day.  I love the sound of the Korean language . I listen to the Korean OTS station on pandora all day and even though I can’t understand it YET, I love it.  This app lets you search by region, genre and more. There are so many shows to watch and from what I can tell new ones come often. The only drawback is when you really like a new one you have to wait weeks sometimes for a new episode. I do find myself needing to step away at times due to not being able to stop until I finish just “one more episode” LOL then realizing only 2 hours of sleep before it is time to wake up. That is my drive to learn Korean so I can listen to the shows as well and not need to focus and read. This way I may get my house cleaned and laundry done. LOL
title: Best App I have ever had

review:
Viki is good.  Viki is cheaper.  I enjoy the content on  both.  But the picture quality, sound and the format on Netflix is superior. 
I love the in-depth reviews on Viki.  It is so much better than Netflix.  I feel as Viki’s audience grow, they will demand more and Viki will do the right thing and get with the “program “.  

I didn’t even include Amazon Prime Video because so many of the Amazon selections “now” have ads.  Amazon has become a loose loose situation for most of their users.
title: Viki is Good …

review: Love this app. I  have used this app for about 4 years now. My daughter got it also,  it has such a great variety of dramas, learning the different cultures. It is my favorite of all apps. I must have watched about 200 or more dramas, some of them over and over. If you don’t mind reading the subtitles , you also will love the.variety.
title: Viki app

review:
I recently began using the Vikki app after being introduced to them via “Alchemy of Souls” and “Love Between a Fairy and Devil”Netflix and Amazon Prime. I searched YouTube for top recommendations and discovered that many classics such as “My Lovely Sasoon” (Awesome) were on Vikki. 

The app itself is pretty stable and I love their detailed descriptions and biographical information on the performers which include their filmographies and other films that I would like if I liked the show I was watching and is pretty spot on. I probably do not fit the typical demographic for this genre (a 68 year old first generation Irish American woman) or maybe I do because I love good drama especially when the subtitles are well done. I still hate dubbed films because it takes away from the authenticity and emotional content of the actors voices.

Thank you Vikki and other streaming apps for the joy of exploring Asian culture through films.
title: This is a wonderful app for fans of Asian Dramas

review: I’ve been watching Viki for 10 years now. I love it. Wholesome entertainment. I’ve pretty much given up on Prime, Netflix and Hulu. I keep coming back to Viki. ❤️

title: Love viki

review: I subscribed to this platform so I didn’t have to worry about today’s trash filled content on US Broadcasting networks which was imposing a social agenda which I didnt agree with as it relates to my teenagers and even young children… you know if you were watching a Korean drama series you didnt mind if your kids approached you because what they would see was not sexually oriented or language inappropriate. That was the case 10 years ago, suddenly they feel the urge to join the bandwagon yet you can still watch lots of family oriented series which seem to be taking the US market by surprise as it is spreading its contents into Netflix, Disney+ and Amazon prime as well as apple TV.
title: Viki saved my sanity with wholesome programming 🥰

title: Schedule time of playing

review:
I recently started using this app because I was looking for a very specific drama and it was on here. I used to only watch the extremely limited selections on Netflix, Hulu, Prime, or even the random niche ones in the animé streaming apps. They all have quite a few but rarely could I find two with the same actor, or they would all be very old ones, or all would be completely different genres. Some of the ones I loved even disappeared like Strong Woman Do Bong-Soon for example. But since using this app and browsing it, I’ve found all sorts of familiar faces, series I had heard of but never found, or series I missed.
I find it very easy to navigate, especially the buttons for the different region dramas. 
The descriptions are good and I love how it lists the actors and then gives you information about them.
I especially love, and this is what actually made me write this review, the subtitle teams. They all have names specific to their dramas and they’re so fun and they do a good job. I love how they will explain in the subtitles what cultural significance and definitions of things are.
Im glad I finally was able to take some time and start using this one.
title: I really like this app

developerResponse: {'id': 34919855, 'body': 'Thanks for reaching out! For any questions or concerns, contact our Help Center: bit.ly/VikiHelp', 'modified': '2023-02-17T05:45:53Z'}
review: I love this app so much! Has such a great collection of dramas, I’ve watched 90% of my personal list on this app. I do want to say that there could definitely be improvements made to the app! Having the timed comments button hidden in the menu options on mobile devices really hinders the experience for me since I like to toggle it on/off at various times. I’d like to see it have it’s own spot on the main screen. Maybe this is just me being picky, but I also notice a slight lag when pressing on the screen to pause or do whatever else on the screen. It’s not as fluid as other apps like YouTube in my opinion, not the end of the world, though. I hope this app can continue to grow more in the future!!
title: Would love some improvements to the UI

review:
I don’t normally write reviews for apps but I felt like one was needed for this. First is I LOVE this app. It’s free to sign up and even if you don’t have viki pass (standard or premium) you still have access to a lot of shows and movies. You can also watch shows while they’re on air as well. The English subtitles are great, nicely translated and not to fast. Btw the subtitle teams work really fast so you don’t have to wait too long for an episode in %100 English to come out.
I also like how you can find collections and how there shows from all over Asia, Japan, Thailand, Korea, China. However lately l have been getting issues with the ads. Whenever an ad comes up or will freeze and the only way to get out of it is to click learn more and go back into the app. Even then it only plays for like 2 seconds or none at all. It’s just really annoying and slows down the experience. I also don’t like how you can’t change your username or profile in general. This is just a preference bc I like to customize things. Overall it’s a great app to watch lots of free shows and movies. Thank, have fun binging <3
title: Good but a few minor problems

review: This is such a great service! It has so many Asian dramas!! I was watching a few of the dramas on YouTube but this is a lot better! It felt like it took more time to find new or exciting dramas that I liked when I was searching for them on my own. Also, I enjoy having many options to choose from as far as C and K dramas. There are new (to me) dramas that are not even on Netflix. I would definitely recommend this service to friends.
title: Rave reviews!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 34761703, 'body': 'Thanks for reaching out! For any questions or concerns, contact our Help Center: bit.ly/VikiHelp', 'modified': '2023-02-09T01:32:58Z'}
review:
Things I like about Vicki: Excellent subtitles. A good selection of new releases and classic movies and tv shows from several Asian countries.

Search feature works pretty well: you can filter by country as well as by genre. You can search by a show’s title, actor’s name or director’s name, but searching by a person’s name will only bring up their IMDB profile. Adding links to an actor or director’s available movies when you search their name would be a helpful addition.

Customer reviews are easy to write and edit. You have option of a numerical rating only (1 to 10 stars) or writing a full review. Reviews with spoiler alerts are marked with an asterisk. They also have a separate “conversation” section where customers can chat about shows they are watching online.

Unfortunately, reviews are not translated, and since I only speak English, I don’t have access to reviews written in other languages. It would be nice if they would add a translator app, as Amazon does for their customer reviews.

Other things I would change or add: 1) add the name of the character under the actor’s picture in the “about” section, as the IMDB picture doesn’t always match their appearance in the movie or tv show; 2) make it possible to search the actors in a scene/cast while watching the movie or tv show (similar to the X-Ray feature on Amazon Prime); 3) move the trailers up to a more prominent place (you currently have to scroll all the way to the bottom of the page on the “about” section. I didn’t discover the trailers until months after I started using the Vicki app); 4) add a customer feedback link to allow customers to make suggestions on improving the app or requesting to add specific shows/movies.
title: Good, but could be great
